info.description: Returns customer accounts information including customers, invoices, adjustments, and payments.
info.title: customerAccounts

tags.name: customers
tags.description: Use this REST API to retrieve basic customer profile information including credit details, payment terms and total balance.

tags.name: invoicePDFs
tags.description: Use this REST API to retrieve printed customer invoice PDF documents.

tags.name: invoices
tags.description: Use this REST API to retrieve customer invoices.

tags.name: payments
tags.description: Use this REST API to record customer payments and retrieve basic customer payments information.

get.summary: Retrieves a single customer invoice payment remittance line instance.
get.description: Retrieves a customer invoice payment remittance line with the specified ID. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice Payment Scope: Customer Accounts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves a customer with the specified ID. Secured by: View: Customer Scope: Customers

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single customer invoice payment instance.
get.description: Retrieves a customer invoice payment with the specified ID. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice Payment Scope: Customer Accounts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single customer invoice or adjustment instance.
get.description: Retrieves a customer invoice or adjustment with the specified ID. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice - View, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Customer Accounts, Project Billing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single customer invoice PDF instance.
get.description: Retrieves a customer invoice PDF with the specified ID. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice - View, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Customer Accounts, Project Billing Contains attachment(s) only

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.description: Creates a single customer invoice payment header instance with the specified data. In the request body, specify at least these required fields: company {id}, type {id}, payment amount and currency, payment date, and payment type {id}. Specify the remitFromCustomer {id} if the ready to auto-apply option is set to true. This endpoint is equivalent to the Record Customer Payment task in Workday. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice Payment Scope: Customer Accounts

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A144 | Enter a company.
A145 | To set the ready to auto-apply option to yes, select a remit-from customer.
A146 | Enter a payment currency.
A147 | Enter a payment type.
A149 | Enter a payment date.
A150 | Payment types with a payment method of "Credit Card" or "Direct Debit" are not supported.
A152 | Enter a total payment amount greater than 0.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of customer invoices and adjustments.
get.description: Retrieves all customer invoices and adjustments. You can filter the invoice and adjustments using the following query parameters: company, billToCustomer, invoiceStatus, paymentStatus, transactionType, fromDueDate, toDueDate, fromInvoiceDate, toInvoiceDate. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice - View, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Customer Accounts, Project Billing

parameters.name: billToCustomer
parameters.description: The customer on the invoice.

parameters.name: fromDueDate
parameters.description: The due date of the customer invoice or invoice adjustment as of the defined reporting date, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: fromInvoiceDate
parameters.description: The date of the customer invoice, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: invoiceStatus
parameters.description:
The current status of an invoice document.

Include invoices with these invoice statuses:
Approved (91b0d382d50848e898733757caa9f84a), 
Canceled (dc76c9b6446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Denied (dc76c7cc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Draft (dc76c4fc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Incomplete(e264bc68581342baa70ab61bf71032fe), 
In Progress (dc76c8bc446c11de98360015c5e6daf6).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

parameters.name: paymentStatus
parameters.description:
The payment status of an invoice document. 

Include invoices with these payments statuses:
Paid (d9e4362a446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Unpaid (d9e43940446c11de98360015c5e6daf6), 
Partially Paid (d9e43706446c11de98360015c5e6daf6).

parameters.name: toDueDate
parameters.description: The due date of the customer invoice or invoice adjustment as of the defined reporting date, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: toInvoiceDate
parameters.description: The date of the customer invoice, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: transactionType
parameters.description: The transaction type of this customer transaction. Use the string "invoice" or "adjustment" to filter to retrieve either only invoices or adjustments.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a single customer invoice print run.
get.description: Retrieves a customer invoice print run with the specified subresource ID for the specified customer invoice or adjustment. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice - View, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Customer Accounts, Project Billing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: subresourceID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the subresource.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.summary: Retrieves a collection of customer invoice print runs for the specified customer invoice or adjustment.
get.description: Retrieves all customer invoice print runs for the specified customer invoice or adjustment. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice - View, Process: Project Billing - View Scope: Customer Accounts, Project Billing

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

get.description: Retrieves all customers. You can filter the customers using the following query parameters: name. Secured by: View: Customer Scope: Customers

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default is 20. The maximum is 100.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection. The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.

200.description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched data.

post.summary: Creates customer invoice payment remittance lines.
post.description: Creates customer invoice payment lines with the specified data for the specified customer invoice payment ID. To create a single instance, specify the single JSON object in the request body. To create multiple instances, specify "bulk=true" as a query parameter. You must specify the JSON object collection in data[ ] in the request body. The maximum collection size is 100. In the request body, specify at least one of these required fields: billToCustomer{id}, invoice {id}, or amountToPay. Secured by: Process: Customer Invoice Payment Scope: Customer Accounts

parameters.name: ID
parameters.description: The Workday ID of the resource.

400.description:
Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
Error Code | Validation Message
--- | ---
A148 | Ensure the invoice company on the remittance detail matches the payment company.
A151 | Ensure the invoice you select for the remittance detail match the payment currency.
A153 | Ensure the currency in the amount to pay of the remittance details matches the payment currency.
A154 | Remittance lines may only be added to payments with payment status in progress or draft, and with payment application status unapplied.
A155 | Either bill-to customer or invoice must be specified for the remittance detail.
A157 | Remittance advice may not be added to cross-currency payments.

code.description: The code that corresponds to the error message. Use the error code to drive programmatic error-handling behavior. Don't use error message strings for this purpose because they are subject to change

field.description: The field related to the error

path.description: The path of the field related to the error

items.description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource

facetParameter.description: The alias used to select the facet

count.description: The number of instances returned by this facet

company_454806779bee100004de1d18a6800009.description: The company for the customer invoice.

currency_ea22ae003e8f100003ff7033ef99005.description: The transaction currency of the customer invoice.

transactionType.description: The type of customer invoice document, either Invoice or Adjustment.

withholdingAmount.description: The tax amount that you withhold from the customer invoice.

inCollection.description: A flag when set to true, places the invoices into collections.

netAmount.description: The total of all invoice line amounts minus the total Tax amount minus the Prepaid Utilization amount. This calculation doesn't deduct the withholding tax. This is the value printed on the customer invoice and can be positive or negative.

disputeAmount.description: The amount you dispute on a customer invoice.

dueAmount.description: The amount due for the customer invoice. The value can be positive or negative.

taxAmount.description: The total tax amount for the document with sign.

disputeDate.description: The date you place the customer invoice in dispute.

dueDate.description: The due date of the customer invoice or invoice adjustment as of the defined reporting date.

memo.example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut, ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
memo.description: The memo for the customer invoice.

inDispute.description: True if the invoice is in dispute.

retentionAmount.description: Total retention amount from invoice lines.

totalAmount.description: The total amount for the customer invoice including tax. The amount can be positive or negative. When the reporting transaction is not an instance of a customer invoice, the amount value is zero.

totalBalance.description: The total customer balance due in the customer currency, as of the report run time. Workday calculates the total balance by adding the amount of all approved and uncanceled customer invoices and subtracting the total amount of all approved and uncanceled customer payments. The customer currency can be the default currency for the tenant, or the currency you define for a given customer.
